definition: to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.english: Mother is darning a hole in Emily sock.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈在为艾米丽织补袜子。
埃米莉姨妈织补旧袜子。

sentences.english: You had better ravel a bit of the left-over cloth to mend the tear in your trousers.
sentences.chinese: 你最好拆散一小块碎布头来织补你的裤子。

sentences.english: She could knit a torn sleeve up.
Grandmother used to darn her own stockings.
sentences.chinese: 祖母过去总是自己织补袜子。

sentences.english: However about 3 weeks after getting it the darn thing died on me.
sentences.chinese: 然而大约3周后得到了织补的事情对我死亡。

sentences.english: You can knit up that sleeve if you gather the stitches carefully.
sentences.chinese: 你要是小心收针就能织补好那个衣袖。

sentences.english: Can you knit a torn sleeve up?
sentences.chinese: 你能织补撕破的袖子吗？

sentences.english: Do you want the hole patched or darned?
For darning and mending all types of medium to heavy weight materials.
sentences.chinese: 对于织补和修复各类中等重物的材料。

sentences.english: 2 with some corroding in the wool that had been dyed black and tiny repairs in the centre.
sentences.chinese: 羊毛上有些啮痕被染成了黑色，中央有细小织补。

sentences.english: Your coat has been mended, is it all right?
sentences.chinese: 您的衣服织补好了，您看是否满意。

sentences.english: Mari refolded the darned pullover and socks.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽把织补过的套头衫和袜子重新叠好。

definition: flying needle and running seam (idiom); skillful needlework
